action_list.description: System action for creating an application

attrs.script:
#script

sleep(180)

$domain = "@@{DomainName}@@"
$password = "@@{Domain_Admin.secret}@@" | ConvertTo-SecureString -asPlainText -Force
$credential = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential("@@{Domain_Admin.username}@@",$password)
Rename-Computer -NewName @@{MSSQL1_VMName}@@
Add-computer -DomainName $domain -Credential $credential -force -restart -Options JoinWithNewName,AccountCreate -PassThru -ErrorAction Stop

#script

sleep(20)
Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role Server -Force

#script
print "EXECUTION_MODE=LOCAL"

$Script = {

Set-Service -Name msiscsi -StartupType Automatic
Start-Service msiscsi

Get-NetAdapter -Name "Ethernet" | Rename-NetAdapter -NewName "Production" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
#Get-NetAdapter -Name "Ethernet 2" | Rename-NetAdapter -NewName "Heartbeat" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

}

$password = "@@{Domain_Admin.secret}@@" | ConvertTo-SecureString -asPlainText -Force
$Creds = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential("@@{Domain_Admin.username}@@",$password)

Invoke-Command -ComputerName @@{address}@@ -Credential $Creds -ScriptBlock $script -Authentication Credssp

$Script = {

$DOMAINNAME=(Get-WmiObject Win32_ComputerSystem).Domain

Install-WindowsFeature -IncludeAllSubFeature -ErrorAction Stop "Net-Framework-Core"
$setupDriveLetter = "D:"
$setupPath = "$setupDriveLetter\setup.exe"
$SilentArgs = "/IACCEPTSQLSERVERLICENSETERMS /Q /ACTION=InstallFailoverCluster /UpdateEnabled=False /INDICATEPROGRESS=True /FEATURES=SQLENGINE,REPLICATION,FULLTEXT,DQ,SSMS,ADV_SSMS /INSTALLSHAREDDIR=`"C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server`" /INSTALLSHAREDWOWDIR=`"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SQL Server`" /INSTANCENAME=`"MSSQLSERVER`" /SQMREPORTING=False /INSTANCEID=`"MSSQLSERVER`" /INSTANCEDIR=`"C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server`" /FAILOVERCLUSTERDISKS=`"Data`" `"Logs`" /FAILOVERCLUSTERGROUP=`"SQL Server (MSSQLSERVER)`" /FAILOVERCLUSTERIPADDRESSES=`"IPv4;@@{SQL_Cluster_VirtualIP}@@;Cluster Network 1;255.255.252.0`" /FAILOVERCLUSTERNETWORKNAME=`"@@{SQL_ClusterName}@@`" /AGTSVCACCOUNT=`"@@{SQL_SVC_Account.username}@@`" /AGTSVCPASSWORD=@@{SQL_SVC_Account.secret}@@ /SQLCOLLATION=`"Latin1_General_CI_AI`" /SQLSVCACCOUNT=`"@@{SQL_SVC_Account.username}@@`" /SQLSVCPASSWORD=@@{SQL_SVC_Account.secret}@@ /SQLSYSADMINACCOUNTS=`"$DOMAINNAME\Domain Admins`" /INSTALLSQLDATADIR=`"E:\MSSQL`" /SQLUSERDBLOGDIR=`"F:\MSSQL`" /SQLTEMPDBLOGDIR=`"F:\MSSQL`""
$validExitCodes = @(0)
$install = Start-Process -FilePath $setupPath -ArgumentList $silentArgs -Wait -NoNewWindow -PassThru
$install.WaitForExit()
$exitCode = $install.ExitCode
$install.Dispose()
Write-Output "SQL Failover Cluster Installation exited with `'$exitCode`'."
    if ($validExitCodes -notcontains $exitCode) {
        Write-Output "Running [`"$setupPath`" $silentArgs] was not successful. Exit code was '$exitCode'. See log for possible error messages."

}

}

$password = "@@{Domain_Admin.secret}@@" | ConvertTo-SecureString -asPlainText -Force
$Creds = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential("@@{Domain_Admin.username}@@",$password)

Invoke-Command -ComputerName @@{address}@@ -Credential $Creds -ScriptBlock $script -Authentication Credssp

$Script = {

$DOMAINNAME=(Get-WmiObject Win32_ComputerSystem).Domain

Install-WindowsFeature -IncludeAllSubFeature -ErrorAction Stop "Net-Framework-Core"
$setupDriveLetter = "D:"
$setupPath = "$setupDriveLetter\setup.exe"
$SilentArgs = "/IACCEPTSQLSERVERLICENSETERMS /Q /ACTION=AddNode /UpdateEnabled=False /INDICATEPROGRESS=True /INSTANCENAME=`"MSSQLSERVER`" /SQMREPORTING=False /FAILOVERCLUSTERGROUP=`"SQL Server (MSSQLSERVER)`" /CONFIRMIPDEPENDENCYCHANGE=False /FAILOVERCLUSTERIPADDRESSES=`"IPv4;@@{SQL_Cluster_VirtualIP}@@;Cluster Network 1;255.255.252.0`" /FAILOVERCLUSTERNETWORKNAME=`"@@{SQL_ClusterName}@@`" /AGTSVCACCOUNT=`"@@{SQL_SVC_Account.username}@@`" /AGTSVCPASSWORD=@@{SQL_SVC_Account.secret}@@ /SQLSVCACCOUNT=`"@@{SQL_SVC_Account.username}@@`" /SQLSVCPASSWORD=@@{SQL_SVC_Account.secret}@@"
$validExitCodes = @(0)
$install = Start-Process -FilePath $setupPath -ArgumentList $silentArgs -Wait -NoNewWindow -PassThru
$install.WaitForExit()
$exitCode = $install.ExitCode
$install.Dispose()
Write-Output "SQL Failover Cluster Installation exited with `'$exitCode`'."
    if ($validExitCodes -notcontains $exitCode) {
        Write-Output "Running [`"$setupPath`" $silentArgs] was not successful. Exit code was '$exitCode'. See log for possible error messages."

}

}

$password = "@@{Domain_Admin.secret}@@" | ConvertTo-SecureString -asPlainText -Force
$Creds = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential("@@{Domain_Admin.username}@@",$password)

Invoke-Command -ComputerName @@{MSSQL2_VM_Public_IP}@@ -Credential $Creds -ScriptBlock $script -Authentication Credssp

#script

#Get-NetAdapter -Name "Ethernet 2" | Rename-NetAdapter -NewName "Heartbeat" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

$Creds = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential("@@{Domain_Admin.username}@@",$password)

Invoke-Command -ComputerName @@{address}@@ -Credential $Creds -ScriptBlock $script -Authentication Credssp

$Script = {

New-IscsiTargetPortal -TargetPortalAddress @@{Prism_Element_DataServices_IP}@@
Get-IscsiTarget | Connect-IscsiTarget -IsPersistent $true

}

$password = "@@{Domain_Admin.secret}@@" | ConvertTo-SecureString -asPlainText -Force
$Creds = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential("@@{Domain_Admin.username}@@",$password)

Invoke-Command -ComputerName @@{address}@@ -Credential $Creds -ScriptBlock $script -Authentication Credssp

attrs.script:
$Script = {
  [System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadWithPartialName('Microsoft.SqlServer.SMO') | out-null
  [System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadWithPartialName('Microsoft.SqlServer.SMOExtended') | out-null
  [System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadWithPartialName('Microsoft.SqlServer.SQLWMIManagement') | out-null

  $SQLCluster="@@{SQL_Cluster_VirtualIP}@@"
  $srv = New-Object ('Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Server') -argumentlist $SQLCluster
  $db = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Database -argumentlist $srv, "@@{DB_Name}@@"
  $db.Create()
  Write-Host $db.name "created at" $db.CreateDate
}

$password = "@@{Domain_Admin.secret}@@" | ConvertTo-SecureString -asPlainText -Force
$Creds = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential("@@{Domain_Admin.username}@@",$password)

Invoke-Command -ComputerName @@{address}@@ -Credential $Creds -ScriptBlock $script -Authentication Credssp
